title: Danish father is finally told driver will be charged over son’s death
content: The driver who hit and killed a tourist in St Julian’s more than a year ago will be charged in court, just weeks after the Danish father spoke out publicly about authorities failing to update him about the case. Asger Emil Neidhardt, a 25-year-old IT entrepreneur, died on October 28, 2023, after he was hit by a Honda Accord driven by a 44-year-old man at the entrance of the Regional Road tunnels. His father, Lars Neidhardt, contacted Times of Malta three weeks ago to express his frustration after his requests for information about the fatal accident went ignored by the Maltese authorities. He described how he was stonewalled by the police and the attorney general as he tried to get information on the progress of any investigation into the death. The Maltese police informed Neidhardt last Friday that the magisterial inquiry into his son’s death had been concluded and that the driver would be charged in court. “I am glad that we finally received some information about what happened,” Neidhardt told Times of Malta. He said it might be a “strange coincidence” how the police reached out to him following a push by Times of Malta and the Danish media outlet TV2, yet, is relieved he finally received information. “This is the first proper and real information we received from Malta about my son,” he said. An e-mail sent by a member of the police victim support unit gives details on how investigations were concluded “some weeks ago” and the inquiry report by the magistrate had also been concluded.  “The driver of the vehicle was detained on site and tested negative for alcohol,” the e-mail reads. The e-mail states that charges against the driver have been issued and the police are awaiting a date for the first court hearing. No details were provided on when the driver will be arraigned or the exact charges he will face. However, Neidhardt has been assured he will be kept informed as next of kin. In a reply to questions, a police spokesperson confirmed police investigations and the magisterial inquiry have been concluded. While Neidhardt said recounting the death of his son was “very hard”, he was pleased he did, as it finally gave him answers.  “Going over all the e-mails from the attorney general, looking up pictures of Asger and having to recount his death has been very hard,” he said. “Reliving the past was difficult but I am glad I did it and finally received some information.”

title: Motorcycle accident in St Paul’s Bay
content: Update:Unfortunately, the 54-year-old Englishman recently lost his life at Mater Dei Hospital.The Magisterial Inquiry and Police investigations are ongoing.Earlier: A 54-year-old Englishman resident in Mellieħa, at around 1700hrs, was taken to Mater Dei Hospital because he was injured in a traffic accident in Dawret San Pawl, St Paul’s Bay.Preliminary investigations showed that the man was riding a Honda motorcycle, lost control and crashed into a skip which was stationary on the road.He was assisted by a medical team, taken to hospital by ambulance and certified to be seriously injured.Magistrate Dr Ian Farrugia LL.D was informed of the case and appointed an inquiry.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: TM suspends permits of contractor responsible for skip involved in fatal crash
content: Transport Malta has suspended future permits for the contractor responsible for a skip left on the St Paul’s Bay bypass that was hit by a motorcyclist in a fatal accident last week. In a statement on Monday evening, TM said it had “suspended any future permits for this contractor until all safety standards are assured,” while confirming the contractor had “illegally” resumed works last week without a valid permit or informing the agency. “These works had been stopped for months, and any resumption without proper authorisation is entirely the responsibility of the contractor,” it said. Dieter Vink, 54, was riding a Honda motorcycle on Wednesday evening when he smashed into the stationery garbage skip placed on the bypass' final curve leading to the Xemxija roundabout. The collision left Vink in a critical condition and he was taken to Mater Dei Hospital for treatment, there succumbing to his injuries on Friday night. Footage of the incident generated an outpouring of grief and anger, with many calling for accountability over what they claimed as negligence on the part of the contractor. Times of Malta has been informed by multiple sources that the contractor in question is JV Infrastructure. Repeated attempts to contact the company were unsuccessful. Vink’s family have said they “want justice, and we will not let him pass in vain,” and have demanded accountability for the events that led to the popular hairdresser’s death. Speaking to Times of Malta less than 24 hours after his death, the family said Vink had suffered catastrophic brain trauma in the accident, with other injuries including a broken right arm, several fractured ribs, a punctured liver and spleen, two black eyes and cuts and bruises all over his body. Fleur Marie Cilia Buckett said the crash helmet the motorcyclist was wearing at the time of the crash looked like “corn flakes,” while stressing Vink was a careful rider. “That could have easily been any of us,” she said. The skip left on the road earlier that day is believed to have been placed there while JV Infrastructure was carrying out works on a boundary wall in the area.  St Paul's Bay mayor Censu Galea said the skip had also been placed on the road a few months before the fatal incident and that residents nearby had complained at the time about it being a danger.

title: Naxxar traffic accident
content: Today, at around 0930hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Salini Street, Naxxar.Preliminary investigations by the Police showed that the accident occurred between three motorcycles – an Aprilia that was being driven by a 31-year-old man from Qormi, a Honda that was being driven by a 40-year-old man from Mqabba and a Yamaha that was being driven by a 29-year-old man from St Paul’s Bay – as well as a Mercedes that was being driven by a 27-year-old woman.The men, aged 31 and 40, were assisted by a medical team and taken to Mater Dei Hospital by an ambulance. The 40-year-old man was later certified to have sustained serious injuries while the other suffered slight injuries.Magistrate Dr Joe Mifsud LL.D was informed about the case and appointed an inquiry while the Police are investigating the case.

title: Two motorcyclists injured in four-vehicle crash on Triq is-Salina
content: Updated 2.25pm Two motorcyclists were injured - one of them seriously - in a traffic accident on Triq is-Salini that involved three motorbikes and a car. The accident was reported at 9.30am close to Kennedy Grove on the southbound lane. It involved an Aprilia, a Honda and a Yamaha motorbike and a Mercedes driven by a 27-year-old woman.  The Aprilia's driver - a 31-year-old man from Qormi, and the  Honda's driver - a 40-year-old man from Mqabba, were taken to Mater Dei Hospital.  The 31-year-old suffered slight injuries while the 40-year-old was seriously injured. The third motorcyclist - a 29-year-old man from St Paul's Bay, and the Mercedes driver were not injured. According to initial indications, one of the motorcyclists lost control of his vehicle and crashed into the two other bikes and car.  Police investigations and a magisterial inquiry are ongoing.

title: Collision between a bus and a van in St Julian’s
content: This morning, at around 1030hrs, the Police were informed about a traffic accident in Triq Mikiel Anton Vassalli, St Julian’s.Preliminary investigations by the Police showed that there was a collision between an Otokar Vectio bus that was being driven by a 37-year-old man from Marsaskala and a Ford Tourneo Courier van that was being driven by a 39-year-old woman from Naxxar.The bus driver was assisted by a medical team and taken to Mater Dei Hospital by an ambulance for further treatment. He was later certified as suffering from serious injuries. The woman of the other vehicle was not injured.Magistrate Dr Philip Galea Farrugia LL.D was informed of the case and appointed an inquiry, while Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Two hurt, one critically, after being hit by pickup in Fgura
content: Two women were badly injured when they were hit by a pickup truck in Fgura on Monday evening. The victims, who are aged 34 and 24 and Nepalese nationals, were on Triq Hompesh at around 8pm when a Toyota Hilux driven by a 20-year-old woman from Birżebbuġa hit them. Both women were given first aid on-site and rushed to Mater Dei Hospital by ambulance. The 24-year-old victim suffered serious injuries and is in a critical condition. The 34-year-old was grievously injured. Magistrate Ian Farrugia is leading a probe into the incident. The incident was one of two major crashes reported on Monday night. In a separate incident, a 25-year-old died after smashing into a tree and signpost in Attard.

title: Fgura traffic accident
content: Update:Unfortunately, the 24-year-old woman recently lost her life at Mater Dei Hospital.The Magisterial Inquiry and Police investigations are ongoing.Earlier:Yesterday, at around 2000hrs, two women, aged 34 and 24 from Nepal, were taken to Mater Dei Hospital after being injured in a traffic accident in Triq Hompesh, Fgura.It resulted from initial investigations that the two women were hit by a Toyota Hilux that was being driven by a 20-year-old woman from Birżebbuġa.The victims were assisted by a medical team and taken to hospital by an ambulance where the 24-year-old woman was later certified to have sustained grievous injuries while the other woman was certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Magistrate Ian Farrugia LL.D was informed about the case who opened an inquiry while Police investigations are still ongoing.

title: Persons injured in separate traffic accidents
content: Two men were taken to Mater Dei Hospital after being injured in two separate traffic accidents earlier today.The first accident occurred at around 0745hrs, in Triq Anton Cassar, Marsa. Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a Suzuki motorcycle driven by a 21-year-old man residing in Fgura and a Toyota Vitz driven by a 21-year-old woman residing in Qormi.The second incident happened at around 0800hrs, in Triq Tal-Barrani, Żejtun. Preliminary investigations showed that a 30-year-old Italian man, who lives in Għaxaq, was riding a Yamaha motorcycle, lost control and fell.A medical team assisted in both accidents and the two motorcyclists were taken to hospital by ambulance for medical treatment, where they were certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Persons injured in separate traffic accidents
content: Two men were taken to Mater Dei Hospital after being injured in two separate traffic accidents earlier today.The first accident occurred at around 0745hrs, in Triq Anton Cassar, Marsa. Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a Suzuki motorcycle driven by a 21-year-old man residing in Fgura and a Toyota Vitz driven by a 21-year-old woman residing in Qormi.The second incident happened at around 0800hrs, in Triq Tal-Barrani, Żejtun. Preliminary investigations showed that a 30-year-old Italian man, who lives in Għaxaq, was riding a Yamaha motorcycle, lost control and fell.A medical team assisted in both accidents and the two motorcyclists were taken to hospital by ambulance for medical treatment, where they were certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist injured in Sliema accident
content: A motorcyclist sustained serious injuries after a traffic accident in Sliema on Wednesday night.  The police said the incident between a Dacia Duster, driven by a 47-year-old Filipino national, and a Kymco Agility motorbike, driven by a 51-year-old Sliema resident took place in Rudolph Street at around 6pm.  The motorcyclist was given first aid on the spot before he was rushed to hospital in an ambulance. His injuries are considered grievous.  Police are investigating.

title: Sliema traffic accident
content: Yesterday, at around 1800 hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq Rodolfu, Sliema.Preliminary investigation showed that a collision occurred between a Dacia Duster that was being driven by a 47-year-old Filipino man from Santa Venera and a Kymco Agility motorcycle that was being driven by a 51-year-old man from Sliema.The biker was assisted by a medical team and taken to Mater Dei Hospital by an ambulance for further medical attention. He was later certified to have sustained grievous injuries.The Police are investigating the case.

title: Fatal motorcycle accident
content: A 36-year-old Italian man, residing in Birkirkara, lost his life late last night in a traffic accident in Msida.The accident happened at around 2015hrs in Mikiel Anton Vassalli Street.From initial investigations it appears that the man was riding a Honda motorcycle and while he was in the tunnel, he lost control, crashed into the wall and fell.The victim was immediately assisted by a medical team and taken to Mater Dei Hospital by ambulance. Unfortunately, he was certified dead shortly afterwards.Magistrate Dr Philip Galea Farrugia LL. D was informed of the case and appointed an inquiry.Police investigations are still ongoing.

title: Persons injured in separate traffic accidents
content: Two men were taken to Mater Dei Hospital after being injured in two separate traffic accidents earlier today.The first accident occurred at around 0500hrs, in Hal Farrug Road, Luqa. Preliminary investigations showed that a 34-year-old man from Qrendi was driving a Ford Fiesta, lost control and crashed into an electricity pole.The second incident happened for about the 1245hrs, in D’ Argens Street, Gzira. Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a Yamaha YB125 motorcycle driven by a 59-year-old man residing in Fgura and a Mazda Demio driven by a 30-year-old man residing in Birkirkara.A medical team assisted in both incidents and the two men aged 34 and 59 years were taken to hospital by ambulance for medical treatment, where they were certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Two men grievously injured in separate traffic accidents
content: Two men were hospitalised on Saturday after suffering grievous injuries in separate traffic accidents. The first accident happened at Ħal Farrug Street, Luqa at 5am and involved a 34-year-old man from Qrendi. The police said the man lost control of the Ford Fiesta he was driving and crashed into an electricity pole. He was taken to hospital for treatment where he was certified to be suffering grievous injuries. In a separate accident later on Saturday, a 59-year-old man from Fgura driving a Yamaha YB125 motorbike was involved in a collision with a Mazda Demio driven by a 30-year-old man from Birkirkara. The accident happened in Rue D’Argens, Gżira at 12.45pm. The motorcyclist was hospitalised with grievous injuries. Investigations in both accidents are currently underway.

title: Two men grievously injured in separate traffic accidents
content: Two men were hospitalised on Saturday after suffering grievous injuries in separate traffic accidents. The first accident happened at Ħal Farrug Street, Luqa at 5am and involved a 34-year-old man from Qrendi. The police said the man lost control of the Ford Fiesta he was driving and crashed into an electricity pole. He was taken to hospital for treatment where he was certified to be suffering grievous injuries. In a separate accident later on Saturday, a 59-year-old man from Fgura driving a Yamaha YB125 motorbike was involved in a collision with a Mazda Demio driven by a 30-year-old man from Birkirkara. The accident happened in Rue D’Argens, Gżira at 12.45pm. The motorcyclist was hospitalised with grievous injuries. Investigations in both accidents are currently underway.

title: Persons injured in separate traffic accidents
content: Two men were taken to Mater Dei Hospital after being injured in two separate traffic accidents earlier today.The first accident occurred at around 0500hrs, in Hal Farrug Road, Luqa. Preliminary investigations showed that a 34-year-old man from Qrendi was driving a Ford Fiesta, lost control and crashed into an electricity pole.The second incident happened for about the 1245hrs, in D’ Argens Street, Gzira. Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a Yamaha YB125 motorcycle driven by a 59-year-old man residing in Fgura and a Mazda Demio driven by a 30-year-old man residing in Birkirkara.A medical team assisted in both incidents and the two men aged 34 and 59 years were taken to hospital by ambulance for medical treatment, where they were certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Van crashes down six-metre-deep valley, two injured
content: Two men were seriously hurt as a van crashed down a six-metre-deep valley in Gozo on Saturday evening. The police said the accident happened at 9pm when a Isuzu WFR went out of control as it was being driven at Triq-ir-Rabat, the road which leads from Victoria (Rabat) to Marsalforn. It ended up in the valley below the road.  The vehicle was being driven by a 25-year-old man from North Macedonia, accompanied by a 36-year-old compatriot, but residents of Żebbuġ. They were rescued by Civil Protection personnel and taken to hospital in a serious condition. The police are investigating.

title: Traffic accident in Gozo
content: Yesterday, at around 2100hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq ir-Rabat, Żebbuġ, Gozo.The Police immediately went to the scene and from a preliminary investigation it was revealed that a 25-year-old Macedonian resident of Żebbuġ, Gozo, lost control of the Isuzu WFR van he was driving and fell into a valley about one and a half stories high. In the van, there was a 36-year-old compatriot also resident of Żebbuġ, Gozo.Members of the Civil Protection and a medical team were called to the scene to assist. An ambulance took the men to the Gozo General Hospital to receive the necessary treatment, where they were certified with grievous injuries.Police investigations are still ongoing.

title: Persons injured in separate traffic accidents
content: Three people were taken to Mater Dei Hospital after being injured in two separate traffic accidents yesterday.The first accident occurred at around 1415hrs, in Triq il-Marfa, Mellieħa. Preliminary investigations showed that a 50-year-old woman residing in Rabat, Gozo, lost control of the Toyota Ractis she was driving and crashed into an electricity pole. The woman was accompanied by a 29-year-old man who lives in Rabat, Gozo.The second incident happened at around 2345hrs, in Triq il-Kappillan Mifsud, Ħamrun. Preliminary investigations showed that a 23-year-old man from Santa Venera had sustained injuries after he was allegedly hit by a vehicle which drove on while he was driving a Suzuki motorcycle.A medical team provided assistance in both incidents and all persons were taken to hospital by ambulance for medical treatment. The woman and the motorcyclist were later certified to have been grievously injured, while the other man was certified to have suffered slight injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist injured in Hamrun hit-and-run
content: A motorcyclist was injured when his motorcycle was allegedly hit by a car which did not stop, the police said. The incident happened just before midnight on Monday as the Suzuki motorcycle was being driven in Triq il-Kappillan Mifsud in Hamrun. The 23-year-old motorcyclist from Sta Venera was assisted by a medical team and hospitalised. The police also reported that earlier on Monday, a man and a woman were hurt when their car crashed into a pole in Triq Marfa, Mellieħa. The accident happened at 2.15pm when a Toyota Ractis driven by a 50-year-old woman from Victoria, Gozo, crashed into an electricity pole. The woman and a 29-year-old man who was a passenger were both seriously hurt.

title: Persons injured in separate traffic accidents
content: Three people were taken to Mater Dei Hospital after being injured in two separate traffic accidents yesterday.The first accident occurred at around 1415hrs, in Triq il-Marfa, Mellieħa. Preliminary investigations showed that a 50-year-old woman residing in Rabat, Gozo, lost control of the Toyota Ractis she was driving and crashed into an electricity pole. The woman was accompanied by a 29-year-old man who lives in Rabat, Gozo.The second incident happened at around 2345hrs, in Triq il-Kappillan Mifsud, Ħamrun. Preliminary investigations showed that a 23-year-old man from Santa Venera had sustained injuries after he was allegedly hit by a vehicle which drove on while he was driving a Suzuki motorcycle.A medical team provided assistance in both incidents and all persons were taken to hospital by ambulance for medical treatment. The woman and the motorcyclist were later certified to have been grievously injured, while the other man was certified to have suffered slight injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Man left with serious injuries after traffic accident in Marsa
content: A man was left with serious injuries after being involved in a traffic incident in Marsa on Monday morning.   The incident happened at around 7am on Triq Aldo Moro, with initial investigations suggesting the man, a Birkirkara resident, had lost control of the Sym Symphony motorbike he was riding and fell.  He was treated at the scene before being taken to Mater Dei Hospital, where his injuries were certified as serious.  Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Man, 75, seriously injured in Xewkija crash
content: A 75-year-old man was seriously injured when he crashed into a wall on Triq l-Imġarr, Xewkija, on Monday morning. The police said the accident was reported at 7am. The man - from Għajnsielem - was driving a Daihatsu Terios.  He was rushed to the Gozo General Hospital. A magisterial inquiry and police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcycle accident in Naxxar
content: This morning at around 0800hrs, a 40-year-old man from Ħaż-Żabbar, was hospitalised at Mater Dei following a traffic accident along the Coast Road in Naxxar.Preliminary investigations showed that the man was riding a Honda CBR motorcycle, lost control and crashed.He was assisted by a medical team and taken to hospital by an ambulance. Later he was certified with serious injuries.Magistrate Dr Joseph Mifsud LL.D was informed about the case and appointed a Magisterial Inquiry whilst Police investigation is still on going.

title: Motorcyclist seriously injured in fall off bike
content: A 40-year-old motorcyclist was seriously injured on Sunday morning when he fell off his bike on the Coast Road.  The police said the accident was reported at around 8am on Triq Tul il-Kosta in Naxxar. The man, from Żabbar, was driving a Honda CBR. A magisterial inquiry and police investigations are ongoing.

title: Cyclist grievously injured in San Gwann accident
content: Today, at about (1045hrs), the Police were informed that their assistance was needed in Tal-Balal Road, San Gwann.The Police went immediately on site and there it resulted that an accident had occurred between a bike, on which there was a 33-year-old Italian man, and a DAF truck, which was being driven by a 32-year-old man residing in Mosta.The cyclist was assisted by a medical team, taken to Mater Dei Hospital by ambulance and certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Cyclist grievously injured in collision with a truck
content: A 33-year-old Italian cyclist was grievously injured on Friday morning in a collision with a truck in San Gwann. A police spokesperson said the accident happened at 10.45am in Triq tal-Balal involving a DAF truck driven by a 32-year-old man from Mosta and the cyclist. The cyclist was treated by emergency services on site and taken to Mater Dei Hospital by ambulance where he was certified to be suffering from grievous injuries. Police investigations are under way.

title: Elderly woman hit by car in Naxxar
content: An 87-year-old woman is in hospital after having been hit by a car in Naxxar on Tuesday morning. The accident happened at 9am in St Paul Street. The driver, a 30-year-old man from Fgura, was unhurt. The police said the woman was seriously injured.

title: Woman grievously injured in traffic accident
content: An 87-year-old woman who lives in Naxxar, at around 0900hrs, was taken to Mater Dei Hospital because she was injured in a traffic accident in Triq San Pawl, Naxxar.Preliminary investigations showed that the victim was hit by a Smart, which was being driven by a30-year-old man residing in Fgura.The woman was assisted by a medical team, taken to hospital by ambulance and certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist injured in Attard crash
content: A motorcyclist was seriously injured when his Kawasaki was involved in a collision with a car in Attard on Sunday. The accident happened at 8.30am in Triq Zafran. The 31-year-old from Birkirkara was given first aid by an ambulance crew before being taken to hospital.   The car, a Toyota Passo, was being driven by a 19-year-old woman from Birkirkara, who was unhurt.   The police are investigating.

title: Collision between car and motorcycle in Attard
content: Today, at around 0830hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq Żagħfran, Ħ’Attard.Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a Toyota Passo driven by a 19-year-old woman residing in Birkirkara and a Kawazaki motorcycle driven by a 31-year-old man also living in Birkirkara.A medical team was called on site and an ambulance took the motorcyclist to Mater Dei Hospital. He was later certified to be seriously injured.Magistrate Dr Ian Farrugia LL. D was informed of the case and appointed an inquiry, while Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist injured in second Sunday accident
content: A motorcyclist was injured late on Sunday in a collision with a car, the second such incident of the day. The accident happened at 8.45pm in Triq Buqana, the road below Rabat, and involved a Kia Avella car driven by a 25-year-old man from Santa Luċija and a Kymco Agility motorcycle driven by a 41-year-old man from  Birkirkara. The motorcyclist was seriously injured and is receiving hospital treatment, the police said. The earlier accident took place at 8.30am in Triq Zufran, Attard and also involved a collision between a car and a motorcycle.

title: Car-motorcycle collision
content: Yesterday, at around quarter to nine in the evening (2045hrs), the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq il-Buqana, Rabat.Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a Kia Avella driven by a 25-year-old man from Santa Luċija and a Kymco Agility motorcycle driven by a 41-year-old man from Birkirkara.A medical team was called on site and an ambulance took the motorcyclist to Mater Dei Hospital. He was later certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Traffic accident in Naxxar
content: Update:Bothdrivers and the double decker passengers were certified with slight injuries.The Magisterial Inquiry and Police investigations are ongoing.Earlier:Today, at around 1515 hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident along the Coast Road in Naxxar.Preliminary investigations by the District Police found that a collision occurred between a Volvo double decker and a Jaguar XF. The Jaguar was being driven by an 81-year-old man from Zebbug who was accompanied by an 80-year-old woman, also from Zebbug. The double decker was being driven by a 39-year-old Kenyan national who lives in Zurrieq and was carrying a number of passengers.A medical team and Civil Protection personnel were called to the scene to assist. Ambulances took the two drivers, the elderly woman as well as three women who were on the double decker, to Mater Dei Hospital for treatment.Later, the 80-year-old woman was certified as suffering from grievous injuries while the conditions of the other persons are still pending.Magistrate Antione Agius Bonnici LL.D was informed and appointed an inquiry while Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Six people, including tourists, hospitalised following crash on Coast Road
content: Updated Monday 8.55am Six people were hospitalised - one with serious injuries - following a crash involving a double-decker bus on the Coast Road. The police told Times of Malta that an accident involving two vehicles - a Volvo 37 bus and a Jaguar XF - was reported at 3.15pm. The bus was being driven by a 39-year-old man - a Kenyan national from Żurrieq. He was rushed to Mater Dei hospital together with three passengers, one of whom is 79 years old. All four suffered slight injuries.  An 81-year-old man from Żebbuġ was driving the Jaguar. In the car with him, there was an 80-year-old woman from Żebbuġ.  Both of them were rushed to hospital, where the female passenger was certified as having suffered serious injuries. The male driver suffered slight injuries. A magisterial inquiry and police investigations are ongoing.

title: Two-car accident in Birżebbuġa
content: Yesterday, at about 1745hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Birżebbuġa Road, Birżebbuġa.Preliminary investigations found that a collision occurred between a Smart driven by a 41-year-old man from Gudja and a Toyota Passo driven by a 36-year-old woman from Żabbar.A medical team was called on site and an ambulance took the man to Mater Dei Hospital. He was later certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Man grievously injured in Birżebbuġa crash
content: A 41-year-old driver from Gudja was grievously injured late on Sunday afternoon in a crash in Birżebbuġa. The police said the accident was reported on Triq Birżebbuġa at 5.45pm. It involved two cars - a Smart driven by the man and a Toyota Passo driven by a 36-year-old woman from Żabbar. Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Car-motorcycle collision in Żejtun
content: Today, at around 0930hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Tal-Barrani Road, Żejtun.The Police went immediately on site and preliminary investigations showed that a collision had occurred between a Mazda Demio driven by a 46-year-old man residing in Żejtun and a Honda motorcycle driven by a 79-year-old man also living in Żejtun.A medical team was called on site and an ambulance took the motorcyclist to Mater Dei Hospital. He was later certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Elderly motorcyclist grievously injured in Żejtun collision
content: A 79-year old man from Żejtun was grievously injured on Thursday morning when the Honda motorbike he was driving was involved in a collision with a car, the police said. The accident happened at 9.30am on Triq Tal-Barrani in Żejtun. The motorbike was involved in a collision with a Mazda Demio driven by a 46-year-old man, also from Żejtun. The motorcyclist was taken to Mater Dei Hospital by ambulance where he was certified to be suffering grievous injuries. The police are investigating.

title: Transport Malta official assisting charity marathon seriously injured in crash
content: Updated 9.45am Godfrey Camilleri, a Transport Malta official, was seriously injured in a crash at 2am on Friday in Mosta. TM, which named the injured  46-year-old, said Camilleri was helping out with  coordination of the annual Puttinu Cares marathon.   The agency added it was in touch with his family to provide any necessary support.

title: Traffic accident in Mosta
content: A 46-year-old motorcyclist resident in Rabat, was seriously injured early this morning in a traffic accident in Mosta.The accident happened at around 0200hrs in Triq iż-Żejfa.Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a BMW motorcycle being driven by a Transport Malta official and a Peugeot 206 driven by a 54-year-old man residing in Naxxar.A medical team was immediately summoned to assist the officer and was then taken to Mater Dei Hospital by ambulance.Magistrate Dr Philip Galea Farrugia LL.D was informed of the case and appointed an inquiry.Police investigations are still ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist left with serious injuries after collision with car
content: A 72-year-old motorcyclist was left with serious injuries Friday after being involved in a collision with a car in St Paul’s Bay. The accident took place on Burmarrad Street at around 1.30pm, when a Mazda Demio driven by a 31-year-old Czech woman from Mosta and the Piaggio motorcycle driven by the man, a Birkirkara resident, collided.  The man was treated at the scene before being taken to Mater Dei Hospital, where his injuries were certified as serious.  Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Car-motorcycle collision in St Paul’s Bay
content: Today, at around 1330hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq Burmarrad, St Paul’s Bay.Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a Mazda Demio driven by a 31-year-old Czech Republic woman residing in Mosta and a Piaggio motorcycle driven by a 72-year-old man who lives in Birkirkara.A medical team was called on site and an ambulance took the motorcyclist to Mater Dei Hospital. He was later certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist grievously injured in Qormi accident
content: A motorcyclist was grievously injured in a traffic accident on Triq il-Wied in Qormi. The police said the crash between a Ford Transit and a Honda was reported at around 8am. The Transit was being driven by a 34-year-old man from Żebbug, while the motorcyclist is a 29-year-old from Qormi. The motorcyclist was rushed to Mater Dei Hospital. Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Car-motorcycle collision in Ħal Qormi
content: Today, at around 0800hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Valley Road, Qormi.Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a Ford Transit driven by a 34-year-old man residing in Żebbuġ and a Honda motorcycle driven by a 29-year-old man who lives in Qormi.A medical team was called on site and an ambulance took the motorcyclist to Mater Dei Hospital. He was later certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Car-motorcycle collision in Marsa
content: Today, at around 0715hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Aldo Moro Street, Marsa.Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a Toyota Aygo driven by a 65-year-old man residing in San Ġwann and a Yamaha GPD125-A motorcycle driven by a 37-year-old Albanian man who lives in St Paul’s Bay.A medical team was called on site and an ambulance took the motorcyclist to Mater Dei Hospital. He was later certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist hurt in Aldo Moro collision with car
content: A motorcyclist was grievously injured on Saturday morning following a collision with a car on Marsa’s Triq Aldo Moro. The man, a 37-year-old Albanian national who lives in St Paul’s Bay, was riding a Yamaha GPD125-A motorcycle. He was involved in a collision with a Toyota Aygo driven by a 65-year-old San Gwann man. The crash was reported to the police at around 7.15am. Emergency services were called to the scene and a medical team took the motorcyclist to Mater Dei Hospital by ambulance. Medics later certified him as being grievously injured. A police investigation into the case is ongoing.

title: Fatal motorcycle accident
content: A 35-year-old man and residing in Qormi, lost his life today afternoon in a traffic accident in St Paul’s Bay.The accident happened at around 1230hrs in St Paul’s Bay BypassFrom initial investigations it appears that the man was riding a Suzuki motorcycle direction to Xemxija, when he lost control and crashed into the barriers.The victim was immediately assisted by a medical team but unfortunately, he was certified dead on site.Magistrate Dr Ian Farrugia LL.D was informed of the case and appointed an inquiry.Police investigations are still ongoing.

title: Tributes pour in for two men who tragically died in separate accidents
content: Tributes have poured in on social media for two men who tragically lost their lives in separate accidents on Saturday. Paul Xuereb, a 67-year-old man from Żebbuġ, died after he was crushed by his own truck in Ħal Far’s industrial estate on Saturday morning. Later on that day, 43-year-old Charlo Calleja from Senglea died after he lost control of his motorbike and crashed on the Senglea seafront.  As news of their deaths spread, friends and relatives shared photos, messages of remembrance, and heartfelt condolences online. Many expressed their shock and grief at the sudden loss of both men. Paul Xuereb Paul Xuereb, more commonly known as Pawlu, used to work with cargo company White Brothers Limited. The company expressed its sorrow in a Facebook post, saying they were “deeply saddened” by the news of his death. “When Paul was part of our team, he was a valued colleague who contributed significantly during his time with us. On behalf of everyone at White Brothers Ltd, we extend our heartfelt condolences to his family and loved ones during this difficult time,” the company wrote. Two of his nephews, each shared a poem commemorating Paul's life, attached with a photo of Paul standing next to a tractor. “Kulħadd jaf li kont ġenwin, Raġel b’valuri, dejjem sinċier u fin (Everyone knows you were genuine, A man of values, always sincere and kind),” one of them wrote.  Many people described Calleja as having a "heart of gold" and a "sweet and natural spirit" Another friend reminisced about their many conversations while sitting on their motorbikes, even as recently as the day before the accident. Someone else posted on their page a picture of Calleja smiling with the caption: “You had a heart of gold, but life can be cruel to us. You will always be in our hearts." "You were one of my best and loyal friends. Fly high, till we meet again," another friend wrote.

title: Motorcyclist hurt in Xewkija crash
content: A motorcyclist was grievously injured in a collision with a car in Xewkija on Friday afternoon, the police said in a statement. The 39-year-old Xagħra man was riding KTM motorbike on Triq l-Imġarr at around 5.30pm when he was involved in a crash with a Mazda CX-3 car driven by a 36-year-old woman, also from Xagħra. A medical team was called to the site and the motorcyclist was taken to Gozo General Hospital by ambulance. Medical personnel there have certified his injuries as being of a grievous nature. A police investigation is ongoing.

title: Traffic collision
content: Yesterday, at around 1830 hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Mikiel Anton Vassalli Street, Msida.Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a Smart that was being driven by a 40-year-old Italian resident in Mosta and a Honda WW125 motorcycle that was being driven by a 45-year-old man who lives in Hamrun.A medical team was called on site and an ambulance took the man to Mater Dei hospital where he was certified to have sustained grievous injuries.The Police are carrying out investigations.

title: Motorcyclist grievously injured in Msida collision
content: A motorcyclist was grievously injured in a traffic accident in Msida on Wednesday evening. The collision occurred at around 6:30 p.m. on Triq Mikiel Anton Vassalli and involved a Smart car driven by a 40-year-old Italian woman residing in Mosta, and a Honda WW125 motorcycle ridden by a 45-year-old man from Ħamrun. The motorcyclist was taken to Mater Dei Hospital by ambulance, where he was certified to have sustained grievous injuries. Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist left with serious injuries after traffic accident in Marsaxlokk
content: A motorcyclist was left with serious injuries Monday after a traffic accident in Marsaxlokk. Initial investigations suggest a collision occurred between a Kymco motorbike driven by a 35-year-old French national and a 30-year-old Ħaż-Żabbar resident on Melqart Street at around 11am. The French national was treated at the scene before being taken to Mater Dei Hospital, where his injuries were certified as serious. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Van-motorcycle collision in Marsaxlokk
content: Today, at around 1100hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq Melqart, Marsaxlokk.Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a Ford Transit driven by a 30-year-old man from Ħaż-Żabbar and a Kymco motorcycle driven by a 35-year-old French man.A medical team was called on site and an ambulance took the motorcycle driver to Mater Dei Hospital, where he was certified to be grievously injured.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: 17-year-old taken to hospital after traffic accident while riding e-scooter
content: A young man was taken to hospital with serious injuries on Thursday night after being involved in a traffic accident while riding an e-scooter. The accident occurred at around 10.15pm on Birkirkara Valley Road, with initial investigations indicating the 17-year-old was involved in a collision with a Mazda Demio driven by a 41-year-old Birkirkara resident. The young man, also a Birkirkara resident, was treated at the scene before being taken to Mater Dei Hospital, where his injuries were certified as serious. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Collision between a car and e-scooter
content: Yesterday, at around 2215 hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq il-Wied ta’ Birkirkara, Birkirkara.Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a Mazda Demio that was being driven by a 41-year-old man from Birkirkara and an e-scooter that was being driven by a 17-year-old man from Birkirkara.A medical team was called on site and an ambulance took the 17-year-old driver to Mater Dei Hospital, where he was certified to have sustained grievous injuries.The Police are carrying out investigations.

title: Teenager critically injured in Balluta Bay jet ski crash
content: A teenager was critically injured in a crash between two jet skis in Baluta Bay on Friday afternoon, police said in a statement on Saturday. The 18-year-old Albanian national was rescued at sea, placed in a dinghy and taken to shore before being rushed to Mater Dei Hospital by ambulance. He was hurt when a jet ski he was riding was involved in a collision with another at around 4.30pm in the bay. Police said they have launched an investigation into the incident. The incident happened a day after an 18-year-old Spanish tourist sustained grievous injuries after she was hit by a boat propeller in Comino.

title: Teen injured in jet‑ski crash at Balluta Bay
content:
An 18‑year‑old Albanian man is in hospital with serious injuries following a collision between two jet skis in Balluta Bay on Friday afternoon.
According to police, the crash occurred at about 4.30 p.m. when the craft struck each other in the popular St Julians bathing area.
The injured rider was taken ashore by dinghy and transferred by ambulance to Mater Dei Hospital, where doctors certified his condition as serious.
Officers were alerted to the incident soon afterwards and visited the scene to collect initial evidence.
The investigation into the causes of the collision is ongoing.

title: Van-car collision in Lija
content: Today, at around 1030hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Mosta Road, Lija.The Police immediately went to the scene and from a preliminary investigation it resulted that a collision had occurred between a Renault Trafic van driven by a 24-year-old man residing in Mtarfa and a Suzuki Swift driven by an 81-year-old man residing in Mosta. In the Suzuki, there was also a 79-year-old woman who lives in Mosta.Members of the Civil Protection Department were called to the scene, as well as a medical team, and ambulances took all the people to Mater Dei Hospital to be given the necessary treatment.Unfortunately, the woman was certified dead a short time later while the other elderly man is in a serious condition. The other man was certified with slight injuries.Magistrate Dr Ian Farrugia LL.D was informed of the case and appointed an inquiry while Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Passenger dead and driver critical following Lija crash
content: A 79-year-old woman from Mosta has died and an 81-year-old man is in a critical condition following a road accident in Lija on Wednesday morning.   The collision took place at around 10.30am on Triq il-Mosta and involved a Renault Trafic van and a Suzuki Swift car. Police said the van was driven by a 24-year-old man from Mtarfa. The Suzuki was being driven by the 81-year-old from Mosta, with the 79-year-old woman, also from Mosta, as a passenger.  Emergency services, including members of the Civil Protection Department and a medical team, attended the scene. All three individuals were taken to Mater Dei Hospital for treatment. The woman was certified dead shortly after arrival.  The 81-year-old man is in a serious condition, whle the condition of the van driver was not known at the time of publication. Magistrate Ian Farrugia is leading an inquiry while police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcycle accident
content: A 65-year-old man, a resident of Mellieħa, was taken to Mater Dei Hospital at about 1015 hrs after he was injured in an accident in Salina Road, Naxxar.Preliminary investigations showed that the man was riding a Honda motorcycle, lost control, crashed into a pavement and fell off.He was assisted by a medical team, taken to hospital by an ambulance and certified thathe was grievously injured.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Motorcyclist grievously injured in Naxxar accident
content: A motorcyclist was grievously injured following an accident in Naxxar on Thursday morning. The 65-year old man, who lives in Mellieħa, was driving his Honda motorbike along Triq is-Salina at around 10.15am when he lost control of his vehicle, crashed into the pavement and fell off his motorbike. A medical team was called to assist him and he was taken to Mater Dei hospital by ambulance where he was certified to have sustained grievous injuries. Police investigations are under way.

title: Fgura traffic accident
content: Today, at around 1530hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Hompesch Street, Fgura.Preliminary investigations showed that a collision occurred between a Toyota Corolla driven by a 23-year-old woman from Zabbar and an Audi Q3 driven by a 77-year-old man from Marsascala.In the Toyota there was also a 71-year-old woman residing in Zabbar while in the Audi there were also two women aged 76 and 42 years, both residing in Marsascala, and two boys aged 14 and 11 years.Members of the Civil Protection Department and a medical team were called to the scene and ambulances took all the persons to Mater Dei Hospital for treatment.Unfortunately, the 71-year-old woman was certified dead a short while later while the 23-year-old woman is in serious condition, the 77-year-old man and the 76-year-old woman were certified to have sustained grievous injuries.The condition of the other persons is still pending.Magistrate Dr Ian Farrugia LL.D was informed of the case and appointed an inquiry.Police investigations into this incident are ongoing.

title: Driver was drunk when cab crashed into hairdresser's salon, court told
content: The motorist who was behind the wheel of a cab that crashed into a hairdresser's shop on Thursday morning was drunk, a court heard during his arraignment on Sunday. Police Inspector Nathan Bugeja told Magistrate Gianella Camilleri Busuttil that the motorist, 42-year-old Somali Abdi Salaan Mahammad Abditon, suffered slight injuries when he lost control of the car and crashed into the salon on Cannon Road, Sta Venera. A breathalyser test in hospital showed an alcohol level of over 100 when he should not have had any alcoholic drink, being a cab driver.  No one was injured in the incident, which happened at about 8am and was recorded on CCTV.  The hairdresser avoided injury because she happened to be outside feeding cats. The defence requested bail, with the legal aid lawyer arguing that his client had not had any previous court cases and did not know the witnesses. The prosecution opposed the request, pointing out that this was a serious case, and the accused had told the police that he wished to speak to the shop's owner. Bail was denied.

title: Hit-and-run victim named as food courier father-of-three Khim Bahadur Pun
content: Updated 5.42pm with doctors' call road safety action The 42-year-old motorcyclist who was killed in a horrific hit-and-run in Birkirkara early on Sunday morning has been named as Khim Bahadur Pun from Nepal. A father of three young children, Pun moved to Malta three years ago and was working as a food courier. He is the 18th person to have died on Malta's roads this year.  Police said the 42-year-old victim, who was residing in Birkirkara, died after a Maserati Levante crashed into the Kymco motorbike he was driving.  Following the impact, the Maserati crashed into three parked vehicles and the three people inside it fled on foot. The 17-year-old driver and his father have been arrested. In a Facebook post, the Non-Resident Nepali Association (NRNA) said they were shocked by the news of Pun's death, all due to an unfortunate road accident.   These, the NGO said, are not radical proposals - they are basic safety measures used successfully worldwide. "The father who died today, and the 17 others before him this year, deserves justice through action. Their families deserve a guarantee that no stone is left unturned so that no other family will endure this preventable heartbreak," the doctors said.

title: 17-year-old arrested over fatal hit-and-run, hours after fleeing scene
content: Updated 12.30pm with more details Police have arrested an underage driver believed to have been behind the wheel of a car that killed a 42-year-old motorcyclist in a horrific hit-and-run in Birkirkara early on Sunday.  The driver, a 17-year-old boy, and an 18-year-old passenger, both from Qormi, were arrested hours after the accident, after fleeing the scene on foot.  Initial investigations suggest a Maserati Levante crashed into a Kymco motorbike driven by the victim, a 42-year-old Nepalese man, residing in Birkirkara. The incident happened at 5.20am on Triq Salvu Psaila.  Following the impact, the car crashed into three parked vehicles.  The victim was pronounced dead at the scene of the accident, while the 17-year-old car driver and two passengers left the scene.  One of the passengers, an 18-year-old girl from Mosta, was found a short distance away from the accident and was arrested. She was taken to Mater Dei Hospital, and was later certified to be suffering grievous injuries. It is not yet known if the driver and the other passenger sustained any injuries.  The Maserati is owned by the driver's father, who was also arrested by the police.

title: Pedestrian injured as parked car is pushed forward during crash
content: Two persons were hospitalised after a car crashed into a parked vehicle in Guardamangia on Tuesday morning. The accident happened at 7am in St Luke's Square, opposite St Luke's Hospital when a Volkswagen crashed into the back of a parked Mercedes. The Mercedes was pushed forward, hitting a man and injuring him. The driver of the Volkswagen was also injured. The police are investigating. No further details were immediately available.

title: Traffic accident in Gwardamanġa
content: Today, at around 0700hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in St Luke’s Square, Gwardamanġa.The Police went immediately on site and preliminary investigations showed that a collision had occurred between a Volkswagen Caddy driven by a 62-year-old man residing in Mellieħa and a Mercedes Benz E320, which was stationary at the side of the road. Consequently, the Mercedes moved forward and hit a 41-year-old woman residing in Valletta.Members of the Civil Protection Department and a medical team were called to the scene and ambulances took the two persons to Mater Dei Hospital for treatment. They were later certified to have sustained grievous injuries.Police investigations into this incident are ongoing.

title: 21-year-old who crashed motorcycle in Pembroke dies
content: A motorcyclist who crashed in Pembroke at 5.30am on Thursday has died, the police said in a brief statement on Saturday. The 21-year-old Italian man crashed his Kymco Agility motorbike into a concrete barrier on Triq Sant’ Andrija and was rushed to hospital in a critical condition. Despite medical teams’ best efforts, he subsequently died in hospital. The motorcyclist is the 19th person to die as a result of traffic incidents this year, and the second motorcyclist to die this past week. In a separate, unrelated incident, a motorcyclist was killed by an underage driver who fled the scene last Sunday morning. The driver was subsequently caught, arrested and charged with manslaughter.

title: Motorcyclist seriously injured following Pembroke accident
content: A 21-year-old Italian motorcyclist was rushed to the hospital early on Thursday morning after crashing into a concrete barricade.  A police spokesperson said the accident happened at around 5.30 am in Triq Sant' Sant'Andrija in Pembroke, in St. Andrew's area.  According to investigations, the man lost control of the Kymco Agility motorbike and crashed into the concrete traffic barricade. The motorcyclist was rushed to the hospital for further medical assistance and was certified with serious injuries. The road leading towards the Coast Road is currently closed.  Magistrate Monica Borg Galea is leading an inquiry into the crash.

title: Motorcyclist injured in traffic accident
content: Early this morning, at around half past five (0530 hrs), the Police were informed that a traffic accident had occurred in Triq Sir Anthony Mamo, Birkirkara.Preliminary investigations showed that a collision took place between a Nissan March and a Honda motorcycle driven by a 57-year-old man, resident in Msida.The man was assisted by a medical team on site and taken to hospital by ambulance, where he was later certified to have sustained serious injuries.In the Nissan there was a 25-year-old woman from St Paul’s Bay who was not injured but was taken to hospital due to shock, while the Police are looking for a man who allegedly was also in the Nissan at the time of the accident, but who allegedly left the scene.Magistrate Dr Monica Borg Galea LL.D was informed and appointed an inquiry, while the Police are carrying out investigations.

title: Woman grievously injured in a traffic accident
content: An 87-year-old woman, who lives in Qormi, at around 0730 hrs, was taken Mater Dei Hospital since she was involved in a traffic accident in Cottoner Avenue, Fgura.Initial investigations, showed that the woman was hit by Mitsubishi L200, that was being driven by a 68-year-old man from Qormi.The woman was assisted by a medical team, taken to Mater Dei hospital by an ambulance and was later certified as suffering from grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: 87-year-old woman injured after being run over in Qormi
content:
Tista' taqra bil- Malti.
An 87-year-old woman from Qormi was hospitalised today after she was run over in Qormi this morning.
The incident occurred at approximately 7:30am on Triq l-Imdina, Qormi. Initial police investigations indicate that the woman was hit by a vehicle driven by a 68-year-old man, also a resident of Qormi.
A medical team attended to the woman at the scene before she was transported to the hospital by ambulance. She has been certified as having sustained grievous injuries.
Police investigations are ongoing.
A previous version of this article incorrectly stated the location of the accident. The police have since clarified that the incident occurred on Triq l-Imdina, Qormi, and not Vjal il-Kottoner, Fgura. We apologise for this error.

title: Man suffers serious injuries in traffic accident
content: A 52-year-old man from Żurrieq, at around 2330hrs, was taken to Mater Dei Hospital after suffering injuries in a traffic accident in a parking lot on Triq il-Mina ta’ Hompesch, Ħaż-Żabbar.Initial investigations revealed that the victim was hit by a Toyota Vitz, which was being driven by a 26-year-old man resident in Kalkara.The man was treated by a medical team, taken to hospital by ambulance and certified as having suffered serious injuries.Magistrate Dr Philip Galea Farrugia LL.D was informed of the case and an inquiry was opened, while investigations by the Police are still ongoing.

title: 52-year-old pedestrian seriously injured after being hit by a car in Żabbar
content: A man was seriously injured after he was hit by a car in a parking area in Żabbar on Tuesday evening.  According to the police, the accident happened at 11.30 pm in a parking area in Triq il-Mina ta’Hompesch, when a 52-year-old man from Żurrieq was hit by a Toyota Vitz driven by a 26-year-old man from Kalkara.  The pedestrian was taken to Mater Dei Hospital, where he was certified to be suffering from serious injuries.  Magistrate Philip Galea Farrugia is leading an inquiry, and police investigations into the accident are ongoing.

title: Pedestrian injured in Pieta' traffic accident
content: A 77-year-old woman was seriously injured in an accident in Pieta' on Sunday. The police said the accident happened at 8.30am at Sa Maison. The woman was hit by a Hyundai I10 car driven by a 75-year-old man from Sliema.  She was hospitalised.

title: Woman grievously injured in traffic accident
content: A 77-year-old woman residing in Valletta, at around 0830hrs, was taken to Mater Dei Hospital because she was injured in a traffic accident in Sa Maison Street, Tal-Pietà.Preliminary investigations showed that the victim was hit by a Hyundai I10, which was being driven by a 75-year-old man residing in Tas-Sliema.The woman was assisted by a medical team, taken to hospital by ambulance and certified that she was grievously injured.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Elderly woman injured as car crashes into a wall
content: A woman, 81 from Sta Venera, was seriously injured on Wednesday morning when the car she was travelling in crashed into a wall. The accident happened in Triq Marsalforn, Gozo, at 8am. The car, a Toyota Corolla, was being driven by an 82-year-old man from Zabbar. The police are investigating.

title: Gozo traffic accident
content: Today, at around 0800 hrs, the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq Marsalforn, Żebbuġ, Gozo.From initial investigations, it showed that an 82-year-old man from Ħaż-Żabbar lost control of the Toyota Corolla he was driving and crashed into a wall. An 81-year-old woman from Santa Venera was also in the vehicle.The woman was assisted by a medical team on site and taken to Gozo General Hospital by an ambulance, where she was certified to have sustained grievous injuries.The Police are carrying out investigations.

title: Elderly pedestrian grievously injured in Gozo traffic accident
content: A 70-year-old man from St Julian’s was grievously injured in a traffic accident in Rabat, Gozo, on Thursday afternoon. The accident happened at around 2.15pm in Triq ir-Repubblika, when the man was hit by a Lintex HT125T-28 motorcycle driven by a 58-year-old man from Rabat, Gozo. Both men were assisted by a medical team at the scene. The elderly man was then taken to Gozo General Hospital by ambulance, where doctors certified him as suffering from grievous injuries. Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Man grievously injured in traffic accident
content: A 70-year-old man residing in St Julian’s, at around 1415hrs, was taken to Gozo General Hospital because he was injured in a traffic accident in Republic Street, Victoria, Gozo.Preliminary investigations showed that the victim was hit by a Lintex HT125T-28 motorcycle, which was being driven by a 58-year-old man residing in Rabat, Gozo.The men were assisted by a medical team and the elderly man was taken to hospital by ambulance, where he was certified to have suffered grievous injuries.Police investigations are ongoing.

title: Car overturns on Mrieħel bypass
content: A car overturned on the Mrieħel bypass on Thursday afternoon.   The blue Fiat seems not to have been involved in a collision with another vehicle.  Police said that the road wardens- LESA took the lead at the scene.   Generally, the Police take over a traffic accident when there are injuries.   For some minutes, both lanes of traffic in the busy main road were closed, but after officials swept the area and removed the shattererd glass that scattered on the road, one lane of traffic re-opened.   Witnesses on site said traffic was flowing.

title: Passengers injured in unfortunate crash
content: A woman and two children were injured late on Saturday when their car was hit by a vehicle which was involved in a crash in the opposite lane. The accident happened on the Gudja Bypass at 11pm. The police explained that the first collision involved a Suzuki Baleno driven by a 49-year-old man from Swieqi and a Hyundai Getz driven by a 19-year-old man from San Ġwann. The Hyundai ended up in the opposite lane where it crashed into a Renault Captur. The Renault was being driven by a 50-year-old man accompanied by two women aged 69 and 43 and a boy and girl, both aged 14, all residents of Rabat. The 43-year-old woman and the children were hospitalised, with the boy suffering a serious injury, police said. The others suffered slight injuries. The police are investigating.

title: Traffic accident in Gudja
content: Late yesterday evening, at around 11:00 p.m. (2300hrs), the Police were informed of a traffic accident in Triq Dawret il-Gudja, Gudja.Police immediately went to the scene, and from preliminary investigations it resulted that a collision had occurred between a Suzuki Baleno driven by a 49-year-old man from Swieqi and a Hyundai Getz driven by a 19-year-old from San Ġwann. Followwing the intial impact, the Hyundai veered into the opposite lane and collided with a Renault Captur.The Renault was driven by a 50-year-old man. Also inside the vehicle were two women aged 69 and 43, as well as a 14-year-old girl and a 14-year-old boy, all residents of Rabat.A medical team was called to the scene, and an ambulance took the 43-year-old woman together with the two children to Mater Dei Hospital. Later, the 14-year-old boy was certified to have suffered grievous injuries, while the girl and the 43-year-old woman suffered slight injuries.Police investigations into this accident are still ongoing.
